title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 December 2012 - XWiki
content:

10:13 <vmassol> has quit  
10:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <mflorea1> has quit  
10:21 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
10:21 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <mflorea> has quit  
10:24 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <vmassol> xwiki.org is not in a good shape...  
10:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have added some documentation for editing/contributing an extension  
10:30 <vmassol> see for ex http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/Meeting+Application  
10:30 <vmassol> letting you know so that it doesn't get overwritten  
10:31 <vmassol> when we upgrade the app  
10:31 <vmassol> maybe we need a better extension point for e.x.o or is it good enough?  
10:31 <vmassol> oops forgot some sentence, strange, fixing  
10:32 <vmassol> actually it's there it's the ##…## which doesn't work for some reason  
10:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: there is already several extensions points in XWiki Repository, we can add  one before the Summary  
10:34 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
10:35 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <sburjan`> has quit  
10:36 <tmortagne> we should never modify a XWiki Repository page if it's not going to be committed  
10:37 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: well normally with the EM it shouldn't be such a problem  
10:38 <tmortagne> vmassol: sure but it's not very clean  
10:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: if you can provide an extension point that would be great  
10:39 <tmortagne> I can probably easily add one like I did for the other things  
10:39 <tmortagne> need to think which part of what you added as standard first  
10:39 <vmassol> ok  
10:39 <vmassol> no hurry  
10:39 <vmassol> just don't want it to be lost :)  
10:40 <tmortagne> better doing it asap or I will forget  
10:51 <cjd> is the bot just broken or are we allowing unregistered users to edit pages?  
10:52 <tmortagne> I doubt guest has rights on extensions:XWiki.WatchListClass  
10:53 <cjd> looks like a bug causing spurious events to be fired then  
10:55 <vmassol> cjd: it's the xclasses created by the code  
10:55 <vmassol> the first time a subwiki is called  
10:56 <vmassol> it's not guest, it's just that the user is null  
10:56 <tmortagne> but they should not be modified each time  
10:56 <vmassol> and the bot says Guest when the user is null  
10:56 <vmassol> they are tmortagne  
10:56 <vmassol> every time xwiki.org restarts  
10:56 <tmortagne> it's a bug then  
10:56 <vmassol> nope  
10:56 <vmassol> well maybe  
10:56 <vmassol> I don't know  
10:56 <vmassol> maybe the flag is not set correctly  
10:56 <tmortagne> I don't see why a class should be modified each restart...  
10:56 <cjd> indeed, there's no reason to modify them unless they're missing something  
10:56 <vmassol> we need to check  
10:56 <vmassol> indeed  
10:57 <tmortagne> it's supposed to check if there is modification to be made  
10:57 <cjd> +1 for the bot telling us about wild events  
10:57 <vmassol> cjd: that's why I left them here  
10:57 <tmortagne> I don't think the issue is in the bot  
10:57 <vmassol> instead of hiding them  
10:57 <vmassol> :)  
10:57 <cjd> /nod  
10:57 <tmortagne> IMO we have a bug in the code updating the classes  
10:57 <cjd> I'd like to add scripting so we can suppress some of the well known ones like the 3 events to create a user"  
10:57 <vmassol> I've already fixed a few things thanks to the bot  
10:57 <vmassol> but there are more  
10:58 <vmassol> cjd: no scripting is needed  
10:58 <vmassol> what we need a is group event  
10:58 <vmassol> s/a is/is a/  
10:58 <vmassol> then the bot can have some generic handling  
10:58 <vmassol> or some specific handling  
10:58 <vmassol> for ex this is what it does already for XAR improts  
10:58 <cjd> scripting would be more generic since you could trap an event and decide programmatically decide whether to suppress it  
10:59 <vmassol> cjd: what I mean is that the code is to be fixed  
10:59 <cjd> like a script which is called on every event and it decides whether to call bot.say()  
10:59 <cjd> /nod  
10:59 <vmassol> cjd: sure but the code has to be fixed to group events first  
10:59 <vmassol> then the bot can have some custom display  
10:59 <vmassol> for ex for xar imports  
10:59 <vmassol> the bot will just report 3 things:  
10:59 <vmassol> that the XAR import has started  
10:59 <vmassol> and that is has finihsed and that so many docs were imported  
11:00 <vmassol> it can do this because xar import correctly sends a group event  
11:00 <cjd> technically an xar import should send a single event because it should only commit a single tx  
11:00 <cjd> ofc that's complicated  
11:00 <vmassol> we can send a single one that's easy  
11:01 <vmassol> I voluntarily sent 2  
11:01 <vmassol> check XARImportEventListener if you want to see the code  
11:01 <cjd> the complicated part is doing the import in a single tx  
11:03 <vmassol> cjd: indeed  
11:05 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/Meeting+Application I needed to separate in two lists (the standard part and the EXO part) but should be ok  
11:09 <vmassol> what part do you wish to be standrad?  
11:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: yeah xwiki.org keeps restarting it seems  
11:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's separated already, the first list contains only one element  
11:10 <vmassol> ok  
11:11 <tmortagne> it's not that obvious visually which is nice  
11:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: I was expecting to see a field on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/EXOExtensionCode/ExtensionSheet  
11:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: look at object editot  
11:11 <tmortagne> the sheet is juts not up to date yet  
11:11 <vmassol> ah yes  
11:11 <tmortagne> s/editot/editor/  
11:12 <vmassol> btw you have a typo "Extension informaton panel"  
11:12 <vmassol> fixing the typo  
11:12 <tmortagne> ok thanks  
11:13 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne  
11:14 <tmortagne> need to export and commit it now  
11:15 <tmortagne> creating a jira issue for the XWiki.WatchListClass class init  
11:17 <polx> has quit  
11:50 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
11:50 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:11 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
12:33 <msmeria> vmassol: should I delete this section ? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments#HDatabaseAttachmentStore28Default29  
12:43 <mflorea1> has quit  
13:01 <vmassol> msmeria: why?  
13:02 <vmassol> it's still the default  
13:02 <vmassol> and still exists  
13:02 <vmassol> cjd: OTOH maybe we should edit http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Attachments#HFilesystemAttachmentStore28SinceXWikiEnterprise3.0M229  
13:02 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
13:03 <vmassol> and remove the warning  
13:04 <msmeria> vmassol: I thought it was used until XE 3.0m2  
13:04 <vmassol> nope the other way around  
13:04 <vmassol> it started with 3.0M2  
13:04 <vmassol> (for FS attachments)  
13:05 <msmeria> i'm going to remove the warning now  
13:08 <vmassol> msmeria: I didn't say that  
13:08 <vmassol> putting it back and updating it  
13:10 <msmeria> sorry. that's what I understood by "remove the warning"  
13:11 <vmassol> fixed  
13:11 <vmassol> msmeria: I was asking cjd  
14:05 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <tdelafosse\_> has quit  
14:18 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <sburjan> vmassol: hello. do we have a pull request link in JIRA ? I only see pull request status, but I don't see any field for puttin the link to the pull request  
14:40 <sburjan> ok, no need anymore :)  
14:41 <vmassol> sburjan: no we don't  
14:41 <vmassol> but you can adda a link to a PR  
14:42 <sburjan> added the link as a comment  
14:45 <cjd> jvelo: I just ran into an issue with ModalBox, it seems that it's relying on Effect.ScaleBy() which doesn't exist (any more?), the new version of modalbox.js doesn't use that anymore: https://github.com/okonet/modalbox/blob/master/modalbox.js WDYT of doing another release?  
14:46 <cjd> Note the reason why nobody else has hit the issue is because it only is called when resize() is called which happens only when you start the box with a DOM element  
14:49 <Slashman> has quit  
14:50 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:50 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <cjd> ahh it's only triggered when height is undefined  
14:58 <tdelafosse> has quit  
15:04 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:11 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <Slashman> has quit  
15:46 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <Slashman> has quit  
16:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <vmassol> guys I'd like to restart jenkins to install a new plugin, ok?  
16:20 <vmassol> (mflorea especially)  
16:21 <mflorea> ok  
16:23 <vmassol> it'll only restart in 48 minutes anyway....  
16:23 <vmassol> bb in 15mn, we can then decide to kill some jobs maybe  
16:45 <polx> has quit  
16:55 <msmeria> has quit  
17:18 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <Enygma`> vmassol: what`s the status on the Push to OW2 release step? http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HPushtoOW2  
17:24 <Enygma`> wrt the latest discussions on the mailing list  
17:25 <Enygma`> do we still have to create a releasenotes.<version> file?  
17:27 <vmassol> I don't think anything has been concluded  
17:27 <vmassol> so I'd say you should follow the release plan  
17:28 <vmassol> (Enygma`)  
17:28 <Enygma`> vmassol: meaning to generate a summary, and all the rest, right?  
17:28 <vmassol> yes  
17:35 <Enygma`> ah, lucky me that this is a bugfix release :)  
17:40 <vmassol> has quit  
17:41 <polx> has quit  
17:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <vmassol> :)  
17:44 <vmassol> Enygma`: AFAIR sergiu (and maybe some others) didn't agree about simplifying and only sending the release notes link  
17:46 <vmassol> Denis1: hi, benjamin has sent some email that you should find of interest. He's sent it to the users list: "[xwiki-users] References Section update proposal"  
17:46 <vmassol> (I asked him to send it mostly for you since we had started a discussion on this topic)  
17:47 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <Denis1> vmassol: the proposal sounds good, wdyt ?  
17:48 <vmassol> ok for me  
17:48 <polx> has quit  
17:48 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
17:50 <vmassol> I'm replying  
17:50 <Denis> vmassol: I do so as well  
17:51 <vmassol> I prefer to use tags  
17:55 <Denis> vmassol: replied  
17:55 <vmassol> thanks  
17:56 <Denis> vmassol: I had also another question, since a while the infra list receive frequent notification of failing infra, this is high traffic and IMO not the same as what the infra list was for before  
17:56 <Denis> shouldn't this notification trafic be on a separate list ?  
17:57 <vmassol> Denis: it seems a bit too much to have 2 lists for infra and since there isn't any much other traffic I don't think we should split ATM  
17:58 <Denis> vmassol: I dislike the idea to have human and machine traffic on the same list  
17:59 <vmassol> this list is for people that want to care about the xwiki.org infra  
17:59 <Denis> vmassol: it will simply cause human traffic to not being noticed, especial such low human traffic  
17:59 <vmassol> let's wait till it happens  
17:59 <vmassol> if you really don't like it make a proposal and propose yourself as maintainer  
17:59 <vmassol> (and creator of it)  
17:59 <Denis> it will for me, I will filter out this list from my inbox  
18:00 <vmassol> or use a proper email tool :)  
18:00 <vmassol> all my email client use a threaded display  
18:00 <Denis> I do as well  
18:00 <vmassol> which makes it impossible for me to miss since all notification are listed under the same thread  
18:01 <Denis> not really  
18:04 <Denis> vmassol: I had 20 threads  
18:04 <Denis> vmassol: some with more than 20 messages  
18:05 <vmassol> yes it means that committers are doing a bad job  
18:05 <vmassol> and not fixing xwiki.org which fails almost every day ATM  
18:05 <vmassol> there are some problems on it, and it's a reminder to fix them, very similar to jenkins actually ;)  
18:06 <vmassol> the good part here is that there's very little false positives … :)  
18:06 <Denis> vl10n is the one which fails most, is it xwiki.org ?  
18:06 <vmassol> vl10n is failing every few hours indeed even worse than xwiki.org  
18:06 <vmassol> it's not the same instance  
18:07 <vmassol> vl10n is l10n.xwiki.org  
18:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:43 <Enygma`> vmassol: can I remove the PURL section from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HPURL ?  
18:43 <vmassol> Enygma`: I don't know, would need to read again the email thread  
18:45 <Enygma`> I have noticed that you had locally (on agent1) removed the purl stuff, but did not commit it  
18:49 <Enygma`> yeah, we still have Sergiu`s -1 on the PURL removal...  
18:51 <Enygma`> vmassol: I think I should unstage the purl removal modifications from agen1 and put them in a branch that I will push on the git repo, to make sure we don`t lose it.  
18:51 <Denis> Enygma`: what is the status of the 4.3.1 release ?  
18:51 <vmassol> Enygma`: ok  
18:52 <Enygma`> Denis, it`s done. I am finishing the announcements as we speak and publishing to maven central. Also, I am waiting for OW2 to make the downloads available (it seems to be taking ages to do so)  
18:52 <Denis> Enygma`: ok, great :)
